id="review-id-c883341f-bd69-3689-8923-bc48bfbb8d5b">This may or may not work for you!!!</h4></div><div class="review-context v-p-top-xxs"><div class="verified-purchaser-mv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" type="button" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay"><svg aria-hidden="true" role="img" viewBox="0 0 100 100" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs"><svg id="Confirm_Line_Sm" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 32 32" xml:space="preserve"><path d="M16 31C7.73 31 1 24.27 1 16S7.73 1 16 1s15 6.73 15 15-6.73 15-15 15zm0-28a13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0 26 13.01 13.01 0 0 0 0-26z"></path><path d="M14.21 class="vertical-align-bottom v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Dec 15, 2019 11:41 PM">2 years ago</time>.</div><div class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->1 week<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">I rode this Scooter a grand total of 16 miles before it failed. I charged it exactly 4 times. I rode it mostly on flat areas with a few hills (which required either me walking it up the hill or helping the motor by kicking with my foot to get to the top of the hill. Today the scooter failed on a 3/4 charge, the scooter would not ride faster than 2 MPH on a flat and level street. I tried both regular and sports mode. I am under the maximum weight for the scooter. I am thinking the motor may have failed. I have reached out to the manufacturer of the scooter to see what is their suggestion to resolve this issue. I also had a problem where the scooter shut itself off mid ride. I think Hover may have a problem with this scooter. I previously contacted them about spare parts (tires, tubes) etc as they do not even list this scooter on their website as a product that they manufacture. I am concerned that Best Buy did not investigate this product and potential issues prior to selling the product to the public. The scooter has a lot of potential, nice wide platform and solid feeling frame. I suspect that the scooter would be perfect if they replaced the 400 watt motor with a 750 watt motor and added a front brake.</p></div><div class="d-block d-md-none"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="rating-group EaseofUse-rating"><div class="rating-description">Ease of Use</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">5 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar filled">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar filled">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar filled">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar filled last">&nbsp;</div></div></div><div class="rating-group Quality-rating"><div class="rating-description">Quality</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">1 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar last">&nbsp;</div></div></div><div class="rating-group Value-rating"><div class="rating-description">Value</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">2 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar filled">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar">&nbsp;</div><div class="rating-bar Every member of our family took a spin and we loved how fast it can cruise. So much fun!

BIG WHEELS &amp; GREAT QUALITY! This scooter isn't cheaply made. The wheels are big and heavy duty.

VERY POWERFUL! With every family member ranging from 80lb to 200lb+ there didn't seem to be any slowing down.

LARGE! This scooter is larger than the others we have seen. The box was big, but we were able to put it in the back seat of a car to get it home. 

(Our twin boys age 9 years old couldn't wait for me to take a photo of them as soon as we got it out of the box. Great joint shared family holiday gift idea even in Minnesota where they ride it in the garage when it is too cold out!)</p></div><div class="d-block d-md-none"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 I am under the maximum weight for the scooter. I am thinking the motor may have failed. I have reached out to the manufacturer of the scooter to see what is their suggestion to resolve this issue. I also had a problem where the scooter shut itself off mid ride. I think Hover may have a problem with this scooter. I previously contacted them about spare parts (tires, tubes) etc as they do not even list this scooter on their website as a product that they manufacture. I am concerned that Best Buy did not investigate this product and potential issues prior to selling the product to the public. The scooter has a lot of potential, nice wide platform and solid feeling frame. Questions</a></div></div><div class="col-xs-7 col-sm-8 col-lg-9 question-list"><ul class="questions"><li class="question-list-item"><div class="question-answer"><h4 class="question-title"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">Q:&nbsp;</span><span class="sr-only">Question</span><a data-track="QnA: Single Question Page" href="/site/questions/hover-1-alpha-foldable-electric-scooter-w-12-mi-max-operating-range-17-4-mph-max-speed-black/6377570/question/dfa8b7a3-2b4b-38d0-905d-3a9ede36a86f" id="question-dfa8b7a3-2b4b-38d0-905d-3a9ede36a86f">Is it hard to fix a flat. And where can you get parts?</a></h4><p class="author"><span class="asked-ago">Asked <time class="submission-date" title="Mar 15, 2020 2:53 PM">1 year ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->Carl<!-- -->.</span></p><ul class="answers"><li class="answer"><div class="answer-text" data-answer-id="e3016bb3-98b0-34cd-8fb6-1e997fe34303" id="answer-e3016bb3-98b0-34cd-8fb6-1e997fe34303" tabindex="-1"><div class="ugc-components ugc-line-clamp"><div class="  " style="height: auto; max-height: none;"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">A:</span><span class="sr-only">Answer</span>&nbsp;<span>We have had 3 flats using this product. Twice it went flat in under two weeks, and the last time it lasted about 2 months. It is not easy fixing the flat. It can be done but with a lot of work. We got the insurance that best buy offers and it costs us $100 to exchange each time. 

Knowing what I know now of this product and how often it gets flats, I would NOT recommend this product to others. It is a blast to use but it gets a flat way too often to justify the price or fun it does offer.</span></div></div></div><p class="author">Answered <time class="submission-date" title="Mar 17, 2020 10:02 AM">1 year ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->ConsumerAdvocate<span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" id="question-8fb51597-1731-35f3-9342-4fcac9b322fd">Why do this scooter drop in speed,more like stalls while riding with the throttle fully engaged?</a></h4><p class="author"><span answer-link" href="/site/questions/submission/6377570/question/7623788?campaignId=QnA_PDP" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-describedby="question-8fb51597-1731-35f3-9342-4fcac9b322fd" data-track="QnA: Answer this Question">Answer this question</a></span></span></div></li></ul><hr class="ugc-line-divider" role="presentation"></div></li><li class="question-list-item"><div class="question-answer"><h4 class="question-title"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">Q:&nbsp;</span><span class="sr-only">Question</span><a data-track="QnA: Single Question Page" href="/site/questions/hover-1-alpha-foldable-electric-scooter-w-12-mi-max-operating-range-17-4-mph-max-speed-black/6377570/question/fec7f2f2-7d3a-3e73-ac34-d38dee177543" id="question-fec7f2f2-7d3a-3e73-ac34-d38dee177543">What model is this really? Is this a M365 Pro?
A ninebot Max? The Hover website does not show this scoot. Is this a BestBuy only product that was made directly for Best buy kind of like the hover-1 Pioneer was made for Walmart?</a></h4><p class="author"><span class="asked-ago">Asked <time class="submission-date" title="Dec 6, 2019 4:56 AM">2 years ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->SuperScooter<!-- -->.</span></p><ul class="answers"><li class="answer"><div class="answer-text" data-answer-id="ae28f96d-3eb2-3059-999e-ab8651c4407b" id="answer-ae28f96d-3eb2-3059-999e-ab8651c4407b" tabindex="-1"><div class="ugc-components ugc-line-clamp"><div class="  " style="height: auto; max-height: none;"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">A:</span><span class="sr-only">Answer</span>&nbsp;<span>It’s built like a Ninebot max with a much smaller battery range, worse brakes, and 6lbs lighter than a max. I own the m365 and this alpha and they are very different. The alpha is more powerful, taller handlebars, much smoother ride due to larger tires, more stable, wider deck more comfortable on feet, much better headlight and display. Also has a speaker if you want to play music while you cruise

The m365 is more slender, has better range is about 10lbs lighter much easier to load in a truck/back seat, better brakes. Much worse ride quality and more prone to flats.

If you weight more than 200lbs or are taller than 5”10 you will appreciate the alpha</span></div></div></div><p class="author">Answered <time class="submission-date" title="Dec 24, 2019 4:41 AM">1 year ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->James562</p><div class="vote-and-further-action "><span class="feedback-voting-reporting"><span class="voting"><button class="c-button c-button-outline c-button-sm helpfulness-button" type="button" aria-describedby="answer-ae28f96d-3eb2-3059-999e-ab8651c4407b" aria-label="Rate this answer as helpful. 18 people found this answer to be helpful." data-track="QnA: Answer: Helpful" id="helpfulness-button-ae28f96d-3eb2-3059-999e-ab8651c4407b">Helpful (<!-- -->18<!-- -->)</button><button class="c-button-link unhelpfulness-button" type="button" aria-describedby="answer-ae28f96d-3eb2-3059-999e-ab8651c4407b" aria-label="Rate this answer as unhelpful. 0 people found this answer to be unhelpful." data-track="QnA: Answer: Unhelpful" id="unhelpfulness-button-ae28f96d-3eb2-3059-999e-ab8651c4407b">Unhelpful (<!-- -->0<!-- -->)</button><span class="c-pipe v-medium" role="presentation"></span></span><span class="report"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button class="c-button-link link report no-margin-r no-margin-l" type="button" aria-label="Report as inappropriate" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="report-overlay">Report</button></span></span><span class="c-pipe v-medium" role="presentation"></span></span><span class="answer-question"><a aria-disabled="false" class="c-button-link answer-link" href="/site/questions/submission/6377570/question/7509895?campaignId=QnA_PDP" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-describedby="question-fec7f2f2-7d3a-3e73-ac34-d38dee177543" data-track="QnA: Answer this Question">Answer this question</a></span></span><span class="show-more"><span class="c-pipe v-medium" role="presentation"></span><button class="c-button-link see-more-answers-link" type="button" aria-describedby="question-fec7f2f2-7d3a-3e73-ac34-d38dee177543" aria-label="See 1 more answer" data-track="QnA: Show More Answers">Show more answers (<!-- -->1<!-- -->)<!-- --> <svg aria-hidden="true" role="img" viewBox="0 0 100 100"><svg id="Caret_Down_Line_Sm" viewBox="0 0 32 32" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M16.05 21.65a.97.97 0 0 1-.6-.2l-12.33-9.3A.98.98 0 0 1 4.3 10.6l11.75 8.85 11.74-8.85a.98.98 0 0 1 1.18 1.56l-12.34 9.3a.97.97 0 0 1-.58.2"></path></svg></svg></button></span></div></li></ul><hr class="ugc-line-divider" role="presentation"></div></li><li class="question-list-item"><div class="question-answer"><h4 class="question-title"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">Q:&nbsp;</span><span class="sr-only">Question</span><a data-track="QnA: Single Question Page" href="/site/questions/hover-1-alpha-foldable-electric-scooter-w-12-mi-max-operating-range-17-4-mph-max-speed-black/6377570/question/6e384cf4-ba23-3235-abdf-dda3df7dc732" id="question-6e384cf4-ba23-3235-abdf-dda3df7dc732">Is this item (battery) FAA approved for commercial flight transport</a></h4><p class="author"><span class="asked-ago">Asked <time class="submission-date" title="Nov 6, 2019 1:37 PM">2 years ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->Anonymous<!-- -->.</span></p><ul class="answers"><li class="answer"><div class="answer-text" data-answer-id="43017e4e-7b3c-35cc-ade5-571eb9db6b73" id="answer-43017e4e-7b3c-35cc-ade5-571eb9db6b73" tabindex="-1"><div class="ugc-components ugc-line-clamp"><div class="  " style="height: auto; max-height: none;"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">A:</span><span class="sr-only">Answer</span>&nbsp;<span>No. According to the FAA, any battery larger than 160 watt hours (Wh) is not allowed in carry on or checked baggage. According to the manufacturers specs, the battery in this unit is 36 volts (V) at 6 amp hours (Ah). The formula for converting volts (V) and milliamp hours (mAh) to watt hours (Wh) is: (mAh * V) / 1000 = Wh. 6Ah from the spec is equal to 6000mAh, so the formula is as follows: (6000mAh * 36V) / 1000 = 216Wh. Since 216Wh is above the allowed 160Wh allowed, this would go against FAA regulations for battery size on an aircraft.</span></div></div></div><p class="author">Answered <time class="submission-date" title="Nov 12, 2019 8:11 AM">2 years ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->Jason</p><div class="vote-and-further-action "><span class="feedback-voting-reporting"><span class="voting"><button class="c-button c-button-outline c-button-sm helpfulness-button" type="button" aria-describedby="answer-43017e4e-7b3c-35cc-ade5-571eb9db6b73" aria-label="Rate this answer as helpful. 15 people found this answer to be helpful." data-track="QnA: Answer: Helpful" id="helpfulness-button-43017e4e-7b3c-35cc-ade5-571eb9db6b73">Helpful (<!-- -->15<!-- -->)</button><button class="c-button-link unhelpfulness-button" class="question-list-item"><div class="question-answer"><h4 class="question-title"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">Q:&nbsp;</span><span class="sr-only">Question</span><a data-track="QnA: id="question-872bf58a-7c11-3244-8faf-7f4e91bd957b">I got a flat. What is the tire size? I know it's 10 inch but by 2 or 3 inches? Also, how do u take the back tire off so I can change the inner tube?
Please help!</a></h4><p class="author"><span class="asked-ago">Asked <time class="submission-date" title="Jun 28, 2020 4:56 PM">1 year ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->Snance2<!-- -->.</span></p><ul class="answers"><li class="answer"><div class="answer-text" data-answer-id="168067f2-4d19-3607-bbaa-a0ecbabe232b" id="answer-168067f2-4d19-3607-bbaa-a0ecbabe232b" tabindex="-1"><div class="ugc-components ugc-line-clamp"><div class="  " style="height: auto; max-height: none;"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">A:</span><span class="sr-only">Answer</span>&nbsp;<span>Join the flat club! I get a flat every time I use it (3times) and yes! The back tire is a pain! Its 10x2.125 by the way. YOU MUST BY WITH valve at an angle or it won't fit properly. I got mine thru Amazon. Waiting for a Solid tire so i don't have to change the flat each time (im a girl by the way) and its getting on my nerve. Ggoo to you tube, that's how i did it go change my tire. It's hard to put it back on. You will need 4 hands. Be careful with the roter, you don't want it to bend. Their product seems fine, it's just the tires are pretty trash. When you replace the tires with solid tires that cannot pop or be flat you never have to worry about flats as long as you have this scooter. I have had 2 big E-scooters and 1 Small one. My issue was I got the Hover 1 Pioneer and not the Alpha, so I exceeded the weight limit on it and one day going about 10 Miles per our the scooter base separated from the frame at the lower part of the handlebar base. Had I got the Alpha which can carry 264 Lbs I would have been fine as I replaced the tires on the Pioneer with 2 solid tires for $40. It's not easy to swap the tires the first time but you get the hang of it and there are vids showing you how. So stay within the weight limit, swap the tires and you're good. Also wear a helmet. According to the FAA, any battery larger than 160 watt hours (Wh) is not allowed in carry on or checked baggage. According to the manufacturers specs, the battery in this unit is 36 volts (V) at 6 amp hours (Ah). The formula for converting volts (V) and milliamp hours (mAh) to watt hours (Wh) is: (mAh * V) \\u002F 1000 = Wh. 6Ah from the spec is equal to 6000mAh, so the formula is as follows: (6000mAh * 36V) \\u002F 1000 = 216Wh. Since 216Wh is above the allowed 160Wh allowed, this would go against FAA regulations for battery size on an aircraft.\",\"badges\":[{\"badgeCode\":\"rewardZoneNumberSilverV3\",\"badgeDescription\":\"Our Elite Plus members have spent $3,500 on eligible purchases in a calendar year.
